relation: Allow selecting desktop / optional components at install (KDE/Gnome/XFCE4/Development/Games/Etc)
Update Software Manager to allow changing optional components on the fly
Create GUI front-end to new PBI9 format files / pbi-manager
Allow file-system selection when doing auto-partitioning.
Merge keyboard layout / timezone / language into single installer page
Don't make "free space" a selectable option during install, require user to create partition first
Convert all remaining apps which use KDE API to pure QT4 only.
Allow specifying the hostname for installed system via the GUI
Provide option in network manager to disable lagg0 device
Create new PC-BSD specific configuration GUI, which provides access to all other config tools, ala system-settings
Create 9.0 Handbook and include offline version with release
textBeforeTable: New Features / Tools planned for 9.0 ↑ https://www.ixsystems.com/ix/support/software/pc-bsd-support ↑ http://www.fail2ban.org/wiki/ ↑ http://www.ossec.net/ ↑ http://www.openbsd.org/faq/pf/ ↑ http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ZFS ↑ http://www.freebsd.org/doc/en_US.ISO8859-1/books/handbook/linuxemu.html References Professional support: professional email and phone support is available from iXsystems[6]. Vibrant community: PC-BSD® has a friendly and helpful support community. Localization: PC-BSD® supports a number of native languages and locales. Easy system administration: PC-BSD® provides a Control Panel containing many graphical tools for performing system administration tasks. Secure environment: PC-BSD® provides a pre-configured PF firewall[3], brute-force attack protection with OSSEC[4], and a Host-based Intrusion Detection System with Fail2ban[5]. secure Laptop support: provides power saving and swap space encryption
